trans-unit.source: Manage DocumentDB capacity | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Manage DocumentDB capacity | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how you can scale DocumentDB to meet the capacity needs of your application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how you can scale DocumentDB to meet the capacity needs of your application.

trans-unit.source: Manage DocumentDB capacity needs
trans-unit.target: Manage DocumentDB capacity needs

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB is a fully managed, scalable document oriented NoSQL database service.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB is a fully managed, scalable document oriented NoSQL database service.

trans-unit.source: With DocumentDB, you don’t have to rent virtual machines, deploy software, monitor databases or worry about disaster recovery.
trans-unit.target: With DocumentDB, you don’t have to rent virtual machines, deploy software, monitor databases or worry about disaster recovery.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB is operated and continuously monitored by Microsoft engineers to deliver world class availability, performance, and data protection.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB is operated and continuously monitored by Microsoft engineers to deliver world class availability, performance, and data protection.

trans-unit.source: You can get started with DocumentDB by [creating a database account](documentdb-create-account.md) through the [Azure Preview portal](https://portal.azure.com/).
trans-unit.target: You can get started with DocumentDB by [creating a database account](documentdb-create-account.md) through the [Azure Preview portal](https://portal.azure.com/).

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB is offered in units of solid-state drive (SSD) backed storage and throughput.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB is offered in units of solid-state drive (SSD) backed storage and throughput.

trans-unit.source: These units are provisioned by creating database collections within your database account.
trans-unit.target: These units are provisioned by creating database collections within your database account.

trans-unit.source: Each collection includes 10GB of database storage with reserved throughput.
trans-unit.target: Each collection includes 10GB of database storage with reserved throughput.

trans-unit.source: If the throughput requirements of your application change, you dynamically change this by setting the [performance level](documentdb-performance-levels.md) for each collection.
trans-unit.target: If the throughput requirements of your application change, you dynamically change this by setting the [performance level](documentdb-performance-levels.md) for each collection.

trans-unit.source: When your application exceeds performance levels for one or multiple collections, requests will be throttled on a per collection basis.
trans-unit.target: When your application exceeds performance levels for one or multiple collections, requests will be throttled on a per collection basis.

trans-unit.source: This means that some application requests may succeed while others may be throttled.
trans-unit.target: This means that some application requests may succeed while others may be throttled.

trans-unit.source: Database account and administrative resources
trans-unit.target: Database account and administrative resources

trans-unit.source: As an Azure subscriber, you can provision one or more DocumentDB database accounts.
trans-unit.target: As an Azure subscriber, you can provision one or more DocumentDB database accounts.

trans-unit.source: Each database account comes with a quota of administrative resources including databases, users, and permissions.
trans-unit.target: Each database account comes with a quota of administrative resources including databases, users, and permissions.

trans-unit.source: These resources are subject to [limits and quotas](documentdb-limits.md).
trans-unit.target: These resources are subject to [limits and quotas](documentdb-limits.md).

trans-unit.source: If you need additional administrative resources, please [contact support](documentdb-increase-limits.md).
trans-unit.target: If you need additional administrative resources, please [contact support](documentdb-increase-limits.md).

trans-unit.source: Databases with unlimited document storage
trans-unit.target: Databases with unlimited document storage

trans-unit.source: A single DocumentDB database can contain practically an unlimited amount of document storage partitioned by collections.
trans-unit.target: A single DocumentDB database can contain practically an unlimited amount of document storage partitioned by collections.

trans-unit.source: Collections form the transaction domains for the documents contained within them.
trans-unit.target: Collections form the transaction domains for the documents contained within them.

trans-unit.source: A DocumentDB database is elastic in size – ranging from a few GB to potentially terabytes of SSD backed document storage and provisioned throughput.
trans-unit.target: A DocumentDB database is elastic in size – ranging from a few GB to potentially terabytes of SSD backed document storage and provisioned throughput.

trans-unit.source: Unlike a traditional RDBMS database, a database in DocumentDB is not scoped to a single machine.
trans-unit.target: Unlike a traditional RDBMS database, a database in DocumentDB is not scoped to a single machine.

trans-unit.source: With DocumentDB, as you need to scale your applications, you can create more collections or databases or both.
trans-unit.target: With DocumentDB, as you need to scale your applications, you can create more collections or databases or both.

trans-unit.source: Various first party applications within Microsoft are using DocumentDB at consumer scale by creating extremely large DocumentDB databases each containing hundreds or thousands of collections with terabytes of document storage.
trans-unit.target: Various first party applications within Microsoft are using DocumentDB at consumer scale by creating extremely large DocumentDB databases each containing hundreds or thousands of collections with terabytes of document storage.

trans-unit.source: You can grow or shrink a database by adding or removing collections to meet your application’s scale requirements.
trans-unit.target: You can grow or shrink a database by adding or removing collections to meet your application’s scale requirements.

trans-unit.source: Database collections
trans-unit.target: Database collections

trans-unit.source: Each DocumentDB database can contain one or more collections.
trans-unit.target: Each DocumentDB database can contain one or more collections.

trans-unit.source: Collections act as highly available data partitions for document storage and processing.
trans-unit.target: Collections act as highly available data partitions for document storage and processing.

trans-unit.source: Each collection can store documents with heterogeneous schema.
trans-unit.target: Each collection can store documents with heterogeneous schema.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB's automatic indexing and query capabilities allow you to easily filter and retrieve documents.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB's automatic indexing and query capabilities allow you to easily filter and retrieve documents.

trans-unit.source: A collection provides the scope for document storage and query execution.
trans-unit.target: A collection provides the scope for document storage and query execution.

trans-unit.source: A collection is also a transaction domain for all the documents contained within it.
trans-unit.target: A collection is also a transaction domain for all the documents contained within it.

trans-unit.source: Collections are allocated throughput based on their specified performance level.
trans-unit.target: Collections are allocated throughput based on their specified performance level.

trans-unit.source: This can be adjusted dynamically through the Azure Preview portal or one of the SDKs.
trans-unit.target: This can be adjusted dynamically through the Azure Preview portal or one of the SDKs.

trans-unit.source: You can create any number of collections to meet the storage and throughput scale requirements of your applications.
trans-unit.target: You can create any number of collections to meet the storage and throughput scale requirements of your applications.

trans-unit.source: Collections can be created through the [Azure Preview portal](https://portal.azure.com/) or through any one of the [DocumentDB SDKs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn781482.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Collections can be created through the [Azure Preview portal](https://portal.azure.com/) or through any one of the [DocumentDB SDKs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn781482.aspx).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Each collection supports storage for up to 10GB of document data.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Each collection supports storage for up to 10GB of document data.

trans-unit.source: Request units and database operations
trans-unit.target: Request units and database operations

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB allows for a rich set of database operations including relational and hierarchical queries with UDFs, stored procedures and triggers – all operating on the documents within a database collection.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB allows for a rich set of database operations including relational and hierarchical queries with UDFs, stored procedures and triggers – all operating on the documents within a database collection.

trans-unit.source: The processing cost associated with each of these operations will vary based on the CPU, IO and memory required to complete the operation.
trans-unit.target: The processing cost associated with each of these operations will vary based on the CPU, IO and memory required to complete the operation.

trans-unit.source: Instead of thinking about and managing hardware resources, you can think of a request unit (RU) as a single measure for the resources required to perform various database operations and service an application request.
trans-unit.target: Instead of thinking about and managing hardware resources, you can think of a request unit (RU) as a single measure for the resources required to perform various database operations and service an application request.

trans-unit.source: Request units are provisioned and assigned based on the performance level set for a collection.
trans-unit.target: Request units are provisioned and assigned based on the performance level set for a collection.

trans-unit.source: Each collection is designated a performance level upon creation.
trans-unit.target: Each collection is designated a performance level upon creation.

trans-unit.source: This performance level determines the processing capacity of a collection in request units per second.
trans-unit.target: This performance level determines the processing capacity of a collection in request units per second.

trans-unit.source: Performance levels can be adjusted throughout the life of a collection to adapt to the changing processing needs and access patterns of your application.
trans-unit.target: Performance levels can be adjusted throughout the life of a collection to adapt to the changing processing needs and access patterns of your application.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [DocumentDB performance levels](documentdb-performance-levels.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [DocumentDB performance levels](documentdb-performance-levels.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Collections are billable entities.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Collections are billable entities.

trans-unit.source: The cost is determined by the performance level assigned to the collection.
trans-unit.target: The cost is determined by the performance level assigned to the collection.

trans-unit.source: Request unit consumption is evaluated as a rate per second.
trans-unit.target: Request unit consumption is evaluated as a rate per second.

trans-unit.source: For applications that exceed the provisioned request unit rate for a collection, requests to that collection will be throttled until the rate drops below the reserved level.
trans-unit.target: For applications that exceed the provisioned request unit rate for a collection, requests to that collection will be throttled until the rate drops below the reserved level.

trans-unit.source: If your application requires a higher level of throughput, you can adjust the performance level of existing collections or spread the applications requests across new collections.
trans-unit.target: If your application requires a higher level of throughput, you can adjust the performance level of existing collections or spread the applications requests across new collections.

trans-unit.source: A request unit is a normalized measure of request processing cost.
trans-unit.target: A request unit is a normalized measure of request processing cost.

trans-unit.source: A single request unit represents the processing capacity required to read (via self link) a single 1KB JSON document consisting of 10 unique property values.
trans-unit.target: A single request unit represents the processing capacity required to read (via self link) a single 1KB JSON document consisting of 10 unique property values.

trans-unit.source: The request unit charge assumes a consistency level set to the default “Session” and all of documents automatically indexed.
trans-unit.target: The request unit charge assumes a consistency level set to the default “Session” and all of documents automatically indexed.

trans-unit.source: A request to insert, replace or delete the same document will consume more processing from the service and thereby more request units.
trans-unit.target: A request to insert, replace or delete the same document will consume more processing from the service and thereby more request units.

trans-unit.source: Each response from the service includes a custom header (x-ms-request-charge) that measures the request units consumed for the request.
trans-unit.target: Each response from the service includes a custom header (x-ms-request-charge) that measures the request units consumed for the request.

trans-unit.source: This header is also accessible through the [SDKs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn781482.aspx).
trans-unit.target: This header is also accessible through the [SDKs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn781482.aspx).

trans-unit.source: In the .NET SDK, RequestCharge is a property of the ResourceResponse object.
trans-unit.target: In the .NET SDK, RequestCharge is a property of the ResourceResponse object.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The baseline of 1 request unit for a 1KB document corresponds to a simple GET by self link of the document.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The baseline of 1 request unit for a 1KB document corresponds to a simple GET by self link of the document.

trans-unit.source: There are several factors that impact the request units consumed for an operation against a DocumentDB database account.
trans-unit.target: There are several factors that impact the request units consumed for an operation against a DocumentDB database account.

trans-unit.source: These factors include:
trans-unit.target: These factors include:

trans-unit.source: Document size.
trans-unit.target: Document size.

trans-unit.source: As document sizes increase the units consumed to read or write the data will also increase.
trans-unit.target: As document sizes increase the units consumed to read or write the data will also increase.

trans-unit.source: Property count.
trans-unit.target: Property count.

trans-unit.source: Assuming default indexing of all properties, the units consumed to write a document will increase as the property count increases.
trans-unit.target: Assuming default indexing of all properties, the units consumed to write a document will increase as the property count increases.

trans-unit.source: Data consistency.
trans-unit.target: Data consistency.

trans-unit.source: When using data consistency levels of Strong or Bounded Staleness, additional units will be consumed to read documents.
trans-unit.target: When using data consistency levels of Strong or Bounded Staleness, additional units will be consumed to read documents.

trans-unit.source: Indexed properties.
trans-unit.target: Indexed properties.

trans-unit.source: An index policy on each collection determines which properties are indexed by default.
trans-unit.target: An index policy on each collection determines which properties are indexed by default.

trans-unit.source: You can reduce your request unit consumption by limiting the number of indexed properties.
trans-unit.target: You can reduce your request unit consumption by limiting the number of indexed properties.

trans-unit.source: Document indexing.
trans-unit.target: Document indexing.

trans-unit.source: By default each document is automatically indexed, you will consume fewer request units if you choose not to index some of your documents.
trans-unit.target: By default each document is automatically indexed, you will consume fewer request units if you choose not to index some of your documents.

trans-unit.source: Queries, stored procedures, and triggers consume request units based on the complexity of the operations being performed.
trans-unit.target: Queries, stored procedures, and triggers consume request units based on the complexity of the operations being performed.

trans-unit.source: As you develop your application, inspect the request charge header to better understand how each operation is consuming request unit capacity.
trans-unit.target: As you develop your application, inspect the request charge header to better understand how each operation is consuming request unit capacity.

trans-unit.source: Choice of consistency level and throughput
trans-unit.target: Choice of consistency level and throughput

trans-unit.source: The choice of default consistency level has an impact on the throughput and latency.
trans-unit.target: The choice of default consistency level has an impact on the throughput and latency.

trans-unit.source: You can set the default consistency level both programmatically and through the Azure Preview portal.
trans-unit.target: You can set the default consistency level both programmatically and through the Azure Preview portal.

trans-unit.source: You can also override the consistency level on a per request basis.
trans-unit.target: You can also override the consistency level on a per request basis.

trans-unit.source: By default, the consistency level is that of session which provides monotonic read/writes and read your write guarantees.
trans-unit.target: By default, the consistency level is that of session which provides monotonic read/writes and read your write guarantees.

trans-unit.source: Session consistency is great for user-centric applications and provides an ideal balance of consistency and performance trade-offs.
trans-unit.target: Session consistency is great for user-centric applications and provides an ideal balance of consistency and performance trade-offs.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on changing your consistency level on the Azure Preview portal, see [How to Manage a DocumentDB Account](documentdb-manage-account.md#consistency).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on changing your consistency level on the Azure Preview portal, see [How to Manage a DocumentDB Account](documentdb-manage-account.md#consistency).

trans-unit.source: Or, for more information on consistency levels, see [Using consistency levels](documentdb-consistency-levels.md).
trans-unit.target: Or, for more information on consistency levels, see [Using consistency levels](documentdb-consistency-levels.md).

trans-unit.source: Provisioned document storage and index overhead
trans-unit.target: Provisioned document storage and index overhead

trans-unit.source: With each collection created you are provisioned with 10GB of SSD backed document storage.
trans-unit.target: With each collection created you are provisioned with 10GB of SSD backed document storage.

trans-unit.source: The 10GB of document storage includes the documents plus storage for the index.
trans-unit.target: The 10GB of document storage includes the documents plus storage for the index.

trans-unit.source: By default, a DocumentDB collection is configured to automatically index all of the documents without explicitly requiring any secondary indices or schema.
trans-unit.target: By default, a DocumentDB collection is configured to automatically index all of the documents without explicitly requiring any secondary indices or schema.

trans-unit.source: Based on applications using DocumentDB, the typical index overhead is between 2-20%.
trans-unit.target: Based on applications using DocumentDB, the typical index overhead is between 2-20%.

trans-unit.source: The indexing technology used by DocumentDB ensures that regardless of the values of the properties, the index overhead does not exceed more than 80% of the size of the documents with default settings.
trans-unit.target: The indexing technology used by DocumentDB ensures that regardless of the values of the properties, the index overhead does not exceed more than 80% of the size of the documents with default settings.

trans-unit.source: By default all documents are indexed by DocumentDB automatically.
trans-unit.target: By default all documents are indexed by DocumentDB automatically.

trans-unit.source: However, if you want to fine tune the index overhead, you can chose to remove certain documents from being indexed at the time of inserting or replacing a document, as described in [DocumentDB indexing policies](documentdb-indexing-policies.md).
trans-unit.target: However, if you want to fine tune the index overhead, you can chose to remove certain documents from being indexed at the time of inserting or replacing a document, as described in [DocumentDB indexing policies](documentdb-indexing-policies.md).

trans-unit.source: You can configure a DocumentDB collection to exclude all documents within the collection from being indexed.
trans-unit.target: You can configure a DocumentDB collection to exclude all documents within the collection from being indexed.

trans-unit.source: You can also configure a DocumentDB collection to selectively index only a certain properties or paths with wildcards of your JSON documents, as described in [Configuring the indexing policy of a collection](documentdb-indexing-policies.md#configuring-the-indexing-policy-of-a-collection).
trans-unit.target: You can also configure a DocumentDB collection to selectively index only a certain properties or paths with wildcards of your JSON documents, as described in [Configuring the indexing policy of a collection](documentdb-indexing-policies.md#configuring-the-indexing-policy-of-a-collection).

trans-unit.source: Excluding properties or documents also improves the write throughput – which means you will consume fewer request units.
trans-unit.target: Excluding properties or documents also improves the write throughput – which means you will consume fewer request units.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: For instructions on monitoring performance levels on the Azure Preview portal, see [Monitor a DocumentDB account](documentdb-monitor-accounts.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on monitoring performance levels on the Azure Preview portal, see [Monitor a DocumentDB account](documentdb-monitor-accounts.md).

trans-unit.source: For more information on choosing performance levels for collections, see [Performance levels in DocumentDB](documentdb-performance-levels).
trans-unit.target: For more information on choosing performance levels for collections, see [Performance levels in DocumentDB](documentdb-performance-levels).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
